question: where is south pole located on a map
api_result: The South Pole is located at the southernmost point on Earth, situated at a latitude of 90 degrees South. On a map, it is found at the center of the Antarctic continent, specifically in Antarctica. If you're looking at a world map, the South Pole is typically represented at the bottom of the map, directly opposite the North Pole, which is located at 90 degrees North latitude.
